intro: Chaenactis tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf rayhead, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers bloom in the spring and are surrounded by narrow, linear leaves. Chaenactis tenuifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
